'''Ubuntu Certified Professional''' ('''UCP'''), which was first introduced in May 2006, is a computer based examination about the [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] operating system.
It is administered by the [[Linux Professional Institute|LPI]] foundation.
This cert is part of the [[LPIC]] as an added module/exam to LPI 117-101 and LPI 117-102 certs.
The LPI UCP exam code is LPI 117-199.
The testee needs to pass all three exams (117-101,117-102 and 117-199) in order to receive a UCP certification. The 101 and 102 exams may be taken before or after the UCP exam.
